do you know the purpose of variables_to_average=variables_to_average in the tf.train.SyncReplicasOptimizer?

It averages the trainable parameters and the moving averages among workers. It does not perform cross-gpu or cross-machine batch norm.

is it possible to modify for distributed batchnorm?

It's very far from that.

can you refer to some examples for the distributed batchnorm with Horovod

With a working horovod training code, adding an option sync_statistics='horovod' to BatchNorm is all you need to do. But for now its performance has a lot of room for improvement (uber/horovod#318 (comment)).

body:
> do you know the purpose of variables_to_average=variables_to_average in the tf.train.SyncReplicasOptimizer? 

It averages the trainable parameters and the moving averages among workers. It does not perform cross-gpu or cross-machine batch norm.

> is it possible to modify for distributed batchnorm?

It's very far from that.

> can you refer to some examples for the distributed batchnorm with Horovod

With a working horovod training code, adding an option `sync_statistics='horovod'` to `BatchNorm` is all you need to do. But for now its performance has a lot of room for improvement (https://github.com/uber/horovod/issues/318#issuecomment-401216615).
